row.process:
! run book function to set environment variable
@echo off :SET &KEYS# = "" :IF &UC4RB_SYSTEM_WIDE# = "YES" : SET &KEYS# = "/M" : IF &UC4RB_OVERWRITE# = "NO" : SET &REG_PATH#='"HKLM\SYSTEM\currentControlSet\Control\Session manager\Environment"' : ENDIF :ELSE :IF &UC4RB_OVERWRITE# = "NO" : SET &REG_PATH#="HKCU\Environment" :ENDIF :ENDIF
:SET &UC4RB_VAR_NAME# = STR_SUB(&UC4RB_VAR_NAME#, '"', '\"') :SET &UC4RB_VAR_VALUE# = STR_SUB(&UC4RB_VAR_VALUE#, '"', '\"')
:IF &UC4RB_OVERWRITE# = "NO" ! checking if variable already exist echo Checking for variable existence.. "%SYSTEMROOT%\system32\REG.EXE" QUERY &REG_PATH# /v "&UC4RB_VAR_NAME#" 2> nul set returncode=%errorlevel% if %returncode% EQU 0 ( echo ERROR: Variable already exists, overwrite not allowed. goto abend ) :ENDIF
echo Setting variable value.. "%SYSTEMROOT%\system32\setx.exe" "&UC4RB_VAR_NAME#" "&UC4RB_VAR_VALUE#" &KEYS# set returncode=%errorlevel% if %returncode% EQU 0 ( echo Successfully set environment variable '&UC4RB_VAR_NAME#' ) else ( echo Failed to set environment variable '&UC4RB_VAR_NAME#' ) exit /b %returncode%
:INCLUDE PCK.ITPA_SHARED.PRV.INCLUDE.CHECK_CMDLINE_CMD@WINDOWS
